::Rodimus Prime/Kup::

Rodimus and Kup both dive deep into the water to avoid the Sweeps attacks.

They both then bob back to the surface with their rifles drawn/ They each fire three shots at each attacking Sweep. Hopefully they would be dealt with that easily because Rodimus had a new target. If the past was coming back Rodimus wanted to take care of Cyclonus and Scourge.

Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:                               
 Above the city sweeps keep up a steady pounding as they move above and
 amidst the buildings. Like a wave of swarm their disintegration beams
 blaze into the buildings below with a frightening intensity. As the
 defensive shields go up and the missile battery opens fire on Scourge,
 like killer bees on the warpath several sweeps fly at the battery, the
 air seeming to almost buzz with laserfire! The defenders at the missile
 battery do manage to pull down a few sweeps, only to have a few more
 take their place and continue firing. 
 
 Lord Perseus and the troops have a similar effect as they lay into the
 sweeps, their blasts cutting down a few sweeps. For a moment there is a
 reprieve as sweeps explode with a satisfying blaze of fire and light.
 But then more come from different directions. It�s like firing into a
 swarm, you hit a few, and a few more come. Their attacks coming from
 everywhere above them and to the sides, laser blasts and disintegration
 beams rock their fortified area, seeking to terminate those housed
 within!
 
 Without any commands from Nightstrike and Darkfate the sweeps around
 the Maximal base just continue to pound on it from above, seemingly
 content to keep anything on the inside the base pent up there. Anything
 so foolish as to step out of its doors face their cannons with a most
 grueling intensity!
 
 In the air above Scourge is only slightly impressed as the Maximal
 (Ravenchief) evades his blast, hoever it is the fact that he is ignored
 totally that sets his nerves on edge. It is then they his proximity
 alarms flip on warning him of the incoming missiles. He chuckles, �Only
 six?? They don�t know me!� With a blast of power he drops down to near
 street level, zipping between tall buildings, far more agile then
 simple missiles. As several of them hit structures rather then him his
 laugh echoes through the streets below. 
 
 Scourge�s laugh slows a bit as he realizes that a few missiles continue
 to follow him then. �Heat seekers.� He grumbles for a moment and then
 chuckles, �This should be fun!� Flying towards one of the large
 buildings he peppers it with laser fire, setting it ablaze. Then with a
 mighty thrust from his hover jets, which put out much less heat, he
 pushes to the side and around the building as the building which is now
 much hotter then he receives the brunt of the remaining missile
 strikes. His laugh echoes once again through the streets as several
 sweeps meet him there and begin to rain destruction! 
 
 In the air somewhat closer to the shoreline, Cyclonus had continued in
 the direction he was going, his jets flaring with power, the wind
 almost screaming as it moved past him! As his own missiles exploded
 spectacularly at the railing he merely flew through blaze, with all the
 attendant dramatic glory, allowing the heat of the explosion to either
 attract Ravenchief�s missiles attention or detonate them. In either
 case he rose high into the air, careful to stay out of the line of fire
 from those on the shoreline below, as the missles just added to the
 wreckage that fell towards the waters below. 
 
 Shifting to his robot mode, Cyclonus turned his gaze to the approaching
 Ravenchief, his form seeming to almost radiate power as he floated in
 mid air. He is tall and almost regal, seeming to be almost made for the
 air boued as he was on powerful thrusters that took the place of his
 feet. 
 
 His voice is deep and resonate, exactly the pitch and timber of the
 Cyclonus of old, �Is this what you wanted Maximal?� Cyclonus lets go
 with two more missiles, quickly the air behind them began to spin, then
 ripple and finally burst aflame as they pulled away from Cyclonus and
 streaked towards Ravenchief!
 
 At the shoreline below Doc manages to hit one of the two sweeps
 menacing him. However these sweeps are not jets and share very few of
 their frailties; they are made for hunting and pursuing hostile prey,
 and their armor is extremely durable. The laser fire smokes along the
 surface of the sweep�s armor, leaving a nasty gash, but does not bring
 it down. The sweeps just slow and stop just over the edge of the water
 and open up with a barrage of laser fire at Doc�s position.
 
 Meanwhile from above several sweeps move down following Rodimus and
 kup, also opening up with cannon fire at the swimming and hopefully
 helpless Maximals below.
 
 Preston
 (Da'minion)
